text: Walter Harper (12 January 1848 – 6 January 1930)Deaths The Times (London, England), Wednesday, Jan 08, 1930; pg. 6; Issue 45405 was Dean of Christchurch from 1901 until 1913.‘HARPER, Very Rev. Walter’, Who Was Who, A & C Black, an imprint of Bloomsbury Publishing plc, 1920–2014; online edn, Oxford University Press, 2014 ; online edn, April 2014 accessed 8 Nov 2014 The son of a former Bishop of Christchurch, he was educated at Christ's College, Christchurch and Trinity College, Oxford; and ordained in 1873.Crockford's Clerical Directory 1908 p 632: London, Horace Cox, 1908 After a curacy in Bebington he was Vicar of Ellesmere then Christchurch. He was Principal of the Upper DepartmentProject Canterbury at Christ's College, Christchurch"Blain's Directory of Anglican Clergy in the South Pacific" and Sub-Dean of Christchurch Cathedral from 1893 until 1900. ==References== Category:1848 births Category:Alumni of Trinity College, Oxford Category:People educated at Christ's College, Christchurch Category:Deans of Christchurch Category:1930 deaths
title: Walter Harper (priest)
